snippet: Stores were looted and homes abandoned in Al Heffa, besieged for days by Syrian forces, and the smell of death hung in the air, said United Nations monitors.
abstract: United Nations monitors in Syria report fiery devastation, the smell of death, vacated homes, looted stores and vestiges of heavy weapons during a visit to Al Heffa, a Sunni-populated village besieged for days by Syrian forces and pro-government militiamen who said they cleansed it of rebel fighters.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from Moscow, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Stores were looted and homes abandoned in Al Heffa, besieged for days by Syrian forces, and the smell of death hung in the air, said United Nations monitors.
